sections.Resolution:
- Conan points out that with the way Sanada had kicked the soccer ball there is no way for the ball to have hit Koh.
- Fukazawa's glasses are damaged.
Shingo Fukazawa is actually responsible for the soccer ball hitting Koh. Conan, disguising his voice as Kogoro, called the manager of the Nishishiba Park and had him check the video footage. In the video footage, Sanada's soccer ball hits Fukazawa in the face, knocking off his glasses. Angry, Fukazawa then picked up the ball and threw it, accidentally hitting Koh and causing the accident.
Fukazawa later apologizes to both Koh and Sanada, and Sanada in turn apologizes to Fukazawa.
sections.Trivia:
- This episode was aired during 2014 FIFA World Cup and was written by The Eleventh Striker's scripwriter, Kazunari Kouchi, as a follow-up to this movie.
- Kaoru Koda reappears in this episode. However, as she was voiced by guest voice actor in movie 16, she was voiced by normal voice actor in this episode.
- Yasuaki Iwasada, the J League Media Promotion manager who in charge of working with Detective Conan production committee during the pre-production of movie 16, voiced Big Osaka forward Ortega in this episode.
